context: The Estonian word 'mõrv' is a noun meaning murder or the act of killing someone intentionally. It can refer to premeditated murder, political assassination, or homicide in general. The word has different grammatical forms: nominative mõrv (singular), mörva (genitive/partitive), mörvad (plural nominative). Related terms include mörvama (verb - to commit murder) and mörvar (noun - murderer).
